title: Re-live: Hawks complete three-peat
text:
AFL: Off one step, from the boundary, a checkside goal in the Grand Final for Hawthorn captain Luke Hodge? Yes please. Fox Sports 03 Oct 2015 Sport/AFL/News Isaac Smith celebrates his third goal against West Coast in the final term. AAP Image/Julian Smith. Source: AAP 
HAWTHORN has won its third consecutive premiership with a crushing 46-point grand final win over West Coast at the MCG. 
The Hawks set up the triumph with a nine-goal streak in the first half, thanks largely to Cyril Rioli’s brilliance. 
FOR FULL LIVE HQ COVERAGE WITH SUPERCOACH SCORES TAP ON THE GAME IN THE SCORE CENTRE ABOVE OR HERE IF YOU ARE ON A MOBILE DEVICE 
Rioli kicked two goals and had a hand in three more as he lodged an early nomination for the Norm Smith medal. 
The Hawks lead by 31 points at half time and they added another five goals in the premiership quarter to make it 60 by the final break. 
Sam Mitchell had a truck load of the ball through the midfield, while Andrew Gaff didn’t stop running for the Eagles. 
Jack Gunston looked untroubled by his ankle injury and finished with a game-high four goals. 
RE-LIVE THE GRAND FINAL ACTION FROM THE MCG IN OUR LIVE BLOG:
